posts.post_content:
The only catch is it can't be one that I already have signed.  Putting aside the Hall of Famers, many of which I need, the signed T206 cards that I know exist that I would gladly pay at least $1,000 for are:

Lena Blackburne
Donie Bush
Gavvy Cravath
Deacon Phillippe
Nap Rucker (Pitching)
George Wiltse
Heinie Zimmerman

And the HOFers, for which I would go much higher, include:

Sam Crawford (Batting)
Roger Bresnahan (Batting)
Fred Clarke (Portrait)
Nap Lajoie (Batting)
Tris Speaker

...and of course, Ty Cobb (any and all poses)

Please let me know if you've got any to share or any leads as to where any of these can be found.  I am particularly interested in the whereabouts of any of the cards in this Mastro lot from May 2001:

[url]http://www.legendaryauctions.com/LotDetail.aspx?lotid=14752[/url]

E-mail [url]SignedT206@gmail.com[/url] if you've got any info at all!
A bump after 2 weeks is reasonable, in my opinion.  At this point, I'm also willing to offer finders fees that lead to the acquisition of signed T206 cards I'm not in possession of.
I'd pay $5,000 for one that has been authenticated by JSA.
